title: 15 best men's skincare products you need in your grooming regime
text:
Beauty has been one of the few industries in the world that has, up until now, been sleeping on men. Sure, we’ve settled for our 2-in-1 hair and body washes, irritating deodorants and questionable beard conditioners, but most of us have grown tired of hiding the fact that yes, we could use a little help too.

It seems the world has woken up to the fact that men want more and the big business that means, with grooming the fastest growing section of the cosmetics industry this year – soon to be worth over £23 billion by 2024.

We are all realising that self-care is important and that there are only benefits from dipping our fingers into the many grooming goodies now on offer.

Not that we will settle for anything; we’re an impatient bunch, barely giving a product one skin cycle (28 days, if you were wondering) before deciding whether or not it has a permanent place in our bathroom cabinets. We want efficacy, we want efficiency and we want extraordinary results.

After months (years, really) of testing a range of products on the market, these are the skincare buys that hold pride of place in our grooming bags. Trust us – you won’t be disappointed.

You can trust our independent reviews. We may earn commission from some of the retailers, but we never allow this to influence selections, which are formed from real-world testing and expert advice. This revenue helps us to fund journalism across The Independent.

Orveda the healing sap: £125, Harvey Nichols

A serum-essence hybrid and the most efficacious product in this list, Orveda’s healing sap is a godsend for all skin types. It is literally like taking a shot of chlorophyll for your face, which is no surprise as the formula derives its actives from nature. The unique mix of 10 potent ingredients work to brighten, hydrate, heal and tone for a complexion that ends up pretty damn perfect. It is the ultimate multitasking maverick.

Buy now

CeraVe SA smoothing cleanser: £12, Look Fantastic

A good cleanser should be many things, but first and foremost should be able to wash away the dirt and debris of the day (or night). CeraVe’s newest cleanser up’s the ante with salicylic acid, an oil-dissolving acid that can remove pore-clogging impurities such as sebum and pollution to clear congested skin. To make the most out of the actives, which also includes CeraVe’s signature ceramides (barrier restoring lipids), massage it into the face for a good minute.

Buy now

Dr Michael Prager urban protect acid peel mask with AHA’s: £141.67, Net-A-Porter

Men have thicker skin than women, which explains why we age a little slower. The downside is that we have more overzealous oil glands, meaning we are more prone to congestion and built-up dead cells. Sort it out with a great exfoliator, like Dr Prager’s, which has all the big boys of the acid world in it – lactic, mandelic, glycolic & salicylic. The cooling gel will slough away skin to keep you fresh faced and feeling like you’ve gone for a facial in Dr Prager’s sleek clinic (highly recommended, FYI).

Buy now

La Mer the replenishing oil exfoliator: £85, John Lewis & Partners

If acids make you nervous, stick with a scrub. While many can be irritating (stay away from any walnut, please) there are a few on the market that are gentle enough to not cause micro-tears but strong enough to have you touching your smooth skin all day (note: don’t!). La Mer’s scrub feels so luxurious you will want to leave it on your face, which is totally acceptable considering the oil it is suspended in is filled with the brands iconic miracle broth.

Buy now

Aesop parsley seed anti-oxidant facial toner: £45, Mr Porter

If you like a mimosa, you’ll love this. It is refreshing, light (and goes down just as quickly) perking up your face with antioxidants and priming it with hydrating. While most toners are normally full of alcohol, the ever-considered Aesop has taken the difficult ingredient out, focusing instead on its philosophy of natural and efficacious formulas. Use this before a cleanser but prior to any serums.

Buy now

111SKIN bio cellulose facial treatment mask: £20, 111SKIN

Birthday party? Business meeting? Big event? Throw a face mask on beforehand. Nothing forces active ingredients deep within the dermis like a great sheet mask, thanks to its bio cellulose body (500x finer than tissue and commonly used to treat wounds) which acts almost like a second skin. Leave it on for a good 15 minutes then pat on any extra essence still in the bag. Hydration heaven.

Buy now

iS clinical super serum advance: £72, Victoria Health

Another strong multitasker that deals with everything from fine lines, wrinkles, pigmentation, collagen production and free-radical protection, iS Clinical’s super serum is aptly named. A 15 per cent concentration of vitamin C would traditionally sensitise your skin, but the stable formula and pairing with copper peptides and botanical antioxidants mitigates all that irritation. Definitely worth the investment.

Buy now

The Inky List caffeine serum: £8.99, Cult Beauty

Coffee is used to wake you up in the morning so why not use it on your eyes too? At least that was the thought process behind the scientist who started testing caffeine against the skin and (no surprise) found out it was as effective topically as it is to drink. Loaded with antioxidants and anti-inflammatory properties, this serum is one of the few that can actually lessen dark circles while alleviating puffiness and water retention (coffee is a diuretic, after all). We’ll take a double shot, thank you.

Buy now

Marie Reynolds face night oil: £37.99, Marie Reynolds

There is a reason Marie Reynolds, who operates her energy healing and master-lift facials from Fortnum & Mason, is referred to as “the witch of the West End”. She’s absolutely magic, a magic that has now been meticulously filtered into her brand’s skincare range. One of the latest highlights includes a dry oil that is packed with natural actives, including a slow release vitamin A that doesn’t cause the inflammation you see from other retinol products. We’re totally enchanted.

Buy now

Augustinus Bader the cream: £125, Augustinus Bader​

There is a reason this cream is a desert island must-have for grooming editor’s everywhere; it just works. Using his years of experience in stem cell research and wound healing, professor Augustinus Bader formulated this cream to kickstart dormant stem cells for an instantly more youthful, brighter, clearer complexion. Get involved.

Buy now

Votary body treatment oil: £55, Space NK

The face comes first, but we have to look after our bodies too. Formulated to deal with rough skin, unsightly bumps and even spots (thank you, salicylic acid), Votary’s body treatment oil will you have you beach (or bedroom) ready after a few goes.

Buy now

Tom Ford bronzing gel: £39, Tom Ford

Bronzing powder is frustrating – you need a brush and sometimes it just sits on the skin, visible to the world. A good gel is sheer, lightweight and totally invisible to the naked eye on the face, giving you a sunkissed, natural glow. Smother this Tom Ford one (which has been a cult classic for quite a while) all over to look like you’ve been on the best holiday, or simply apply it above the beard line, at the top of the forehead, under the jaw and along the nose to give your face a touch of definition. It’s healthy looking skin in a bottle.

Buy now

Clinique aloe shave gel: £16, Clinique

Aloe vera is cooling, soothing, anti-inflammatory and anti-bacterial, so it is no shock that Clinique has cleverly made it the base ingredient in its shaving gel. It makes for a beautiful, smooth shave, softens any facial hair and infuses the skin with the hydrating properties that aloe vera also has.

Buy now

Sisley confort extreme hand cream: £45.95, All Beauty

Hands are (believe it or not) one of the first things people notice on a man – after all, the moment we meet someone we shake their hands. That is why a great hand product is so important. If you are after one that gives you a silk glove of nutrition, moisture and protection then look no further than Sisley’s buttery cream. Despite the ultra-soft texture, the formula absorbs instantly, is non-greasy and will leave you wanting to shake everyone’s hand (just to show off).

Buy now

Mauli Rituals grow strong hair oil: £32, Mauli Rituals

A solid hair and beard oil is a man’s secret weapon. Hear us out – your beard will be soft (which your partner will appreciate), your hair will remain thick (clinical studies link using botanical oils on your scalp to healthy hair follicles) and you’ll have the sheen of a freshly groomed retriever. The Mauli Rituals oil takes it one step further, using ayurvedic ingredients that have 2000+ years of research behind them to stimulate hair growth and nourish strands. Now go fetch!

Buy now

The verdict: Men’s skincare

Strong, soothing and sustainable, Orveda’s healing sap is a state-of-the-art answer to great skincare. The potent formula is as versatile as they come, addressing all concerns and conditions without compromise while the aqueous texture is so luxurious you’ll want to swim in it. If you can afford it, please do.

IndyBest product reviews are unbiased, independent advice you can trust. On some occasions, we earn revenue if you click the links and buy the products, but we never allow this to bias our coverage. The reviews are compiled through a mix of expert opinion and real-world testing.
description: Up your grooming game with the best men's skincare from Clinique, Aesop, Sisley and more
